meanings.definition: A downward trend or decline in a situation or condition.
meanings.sent1: The downslide in the company's profits was concerning to the shareholders.
meanings.sent2: The economy experienced a downslide after the stock market crash.
meanings.sent3: The downslide in ice cream sales during winter was expected.
meanings.sent4: The downslide of the team's performance was like a rollercoaster ride.
meanings.sent5: The downslide of the mountain was treacherous for hikers.

meanings.definition: To decline or deteriorate in quality or value.
meanings.sent1: The quality of the product began to downslide after the new supplier was chosen.
meanings.sent2: Her health started to downslide after she stopped exercising regularly.
meanings.sent3: I watched my grades downslide as I spent more time playing video games.
meanings.sent4: The relationship between the two countries continued to downslide with each disagreement.
meanings.sent5: The old house began to downslide in value as the neighborhood improved.
